Recipe.Description: Basic pasta dough recipe using standard ratio of 1 egg per 1 cup of flour.

Ingredient.Name: Flour
Ingredient.Notes: High protein, King Arthur Bread Flour.

Method.Step: Place mound of flour on counter, make well in flour, like a crater in a mountain. Add egg and salt to crater.
Stir flour into egg from sides of crater until ball of dough begins to form.
Knead dough until smooth. Add water as needed to keep dough workable.
Cover dough ball with damp towel and let rest for 30 minutes.
Pass piece of dough through pasta machine.
Continue passing dough strip through pasta machine, reducing thickness with each pass until desired thickness is reached.
Dough can be used as is to make lasagna or ravioli, etc. Or it can be cut or passed through the pasta machine to make fettucini, linguine, etc. Dust the dough strip with flour and cover with a towel.
To hand cut the pasta, fold by thirds.
Cut the pasta into the desired widths.
Dust the pasta with flour and dry slightly before using.

Variations.Variation: Use red wine instead of water.
